name: Ana F
text: Yuri and Jennifer were so nice when we visited the store. They answered all of our questions and concerns. I didn’t receive a MetroPcs survey for them so I wanted to post to say just how awesome they were!

name: David Goodwin
text: They got phones an will fix you up with a good one

name: Vicki Irons
text: The workers went way out of their to help me transfer all my stuff to my new phone!

name: Wayne Earp
text: I bought a defective phone from them and when i called the store a few days later they took my information and said they would call me when the new phone came in after two weeks and i haven't heard anything so i called back and then they tell me we don't take information over the phone i would have to come to the store which i did only to be informed i waited to long which was less than 30 days. Do not buy a phone or get service through metro they don't stand behind what they sell.

text:
It was perfect.
Amazing customer service.

name: jordan pierson
text: Super fast and friendly. Nicest employees in Montgomery. Definitely my go to AT&T from now on.

name: NoseyByNature
text: Rudely turned away despite store being open to the public. Customer service representative was sitting inside watching a movie and smoking cigarettes while paying customers were outside.  I will not be going back to this location and I hope this is not a representative of other AT&T stores during covid19.

resp.text: Hi! Thank you for your feedback. We'll pass along your comments to leadership so they can address and provide further training. We look forward to assisting you again!

name: Oriana Arrieta
text: This location is no longer open!

resp.text: Hi Oriana! Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We will share your comments with the leadership.

name: patricia thompson
text: Do not get sucked into att. They are the worst company . They put items on your bill without notifying you.  They double bill when they make a mistake and you pay for it .

name: Kelsey Kennedy-Ingram
text: If I can give a zero star, I really would do so.Staff doesn’t seem to know what they are doing. Took me an hour to do a simple upgrade.{Yes I was the only customer in store}only to find out my card was charged twice for the same transaction.Just take the trip to another at&t store for better service.

name: Henry Jackson
text: I enjoyed my experience here at this BRAND NEW location. I was treated like family as they welcomed me into the store, and they didn't sugar coat anything. Gave it to me straightforward and they have slot of great deals. I will be going back to get TV and Internet with them!

name: Alexis Pickney
text: I’m happy this new store has open. It has made it more convient for me to come do business. The store manager is very helpful and has amazing customer service.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
text: The new manager is absolutely great. She is very informative & gives great customer service. Definitely my new favorite AT&T!

name: Dontrez Long
text: The staff was amazing! Will definitely be bringing all my services here.

text: Cable is expensive like the others. Sometimes you get a good deals on services.

text: Great, excellent service! They were nice and helpful

name: Margaret Denton
text: Great staff! Resolved my issues in under 5minutes. very helpful.

resp.text: Hi Oriana! Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We will share your comments with the leadership.

text: Genea was absolutely great!

name: S. M. Pettus
text: Poor customer service

resp.text: Hi S. M., I am sorry to hear about your experience at our store. We appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking to improve. Our goal is to provide you with the customer service you deserve in the future. We hope to connect with you soon!

name: Demetria Steele
text: Great service!

name: Juran Gulley
text: The person that assisted me was very professional and kind I really recommend him totally awesome thank you so much will return soon

name: Jennifer Vines
text:
They ripped me off
I paid $99 for a upgrade and added a line. I was supposed to get a second phone for free. They said there wasn't a special going.
The corporate Customer Care number asked them to give me the phone when I went back the next day, (after a few long convos w corporate), and they would pay the owner for the phone if they had to.
They were false advertisng to get the $99 upgrade for half off when you add a line and upgrade, then said that special was over when they still had the advertisements for the special by the phones.
I was told it changed to buy one at $99 and get one free w upgrade and added line the next day.
Rip off scam artists whose employee probably sold my, "free", phone online.
I even paid the $25 fee to add the line as well as activation for the phone I NEVER RECEIVED.
Switching carries A.S.A.P. after being a customer for 5+ yrs due to this.
The same man owns the Homewood store, so be wary of rip offs there as well!

name: Aaa Ouda
text: Worst of the worst

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear this. That’s not the experience we want for our customers! Can you email me at DLRBirminghamNorthFeedback@T-Mobile.com so I can get this fixed for you?

name: Fred Utley
text: Good service good employers I'm always glad to visit them !

name: j
text: I was in need of a new phone and I saw that metro pcs has a deal if you switch carriers you can get a phone for $49. I called the store to find out how much would it cost for phone plus activation and was told $170.when I went to the store later that same day the guy at the counter that waited on me told me the price was $180.after explaining I got an earlier quote for $170 he obliged. I received a case with the phone thinking it was complimentary. I looked at my receipt a few days later and discovered not only did they charge me for a case I didn’t ask for they also charged me for antivirus software I didn’t ask for. I could not get the guy who waited on me to give me a refund on the case because I already had a case for the phone I contacted the manager and he would not refund me either he then told me I got a good deal on the phone and should be satisfied and suggested I could bring the phone back and get a refund. I will be contact corporate office to get resolution.it is not a lot of money but it’s my money and I have the right to spend my money the way I choose and not have someone to cheat me out of it.Bad Business Practices

name: M
text: The Crestwood location is Awesome!!! I have been to 4 another location today. Thank you Gabriel. You Rock.

name: Gabe B
text: These people are great with customer service the black guy knows exactly what he’s talking about and is 100% honest about any phone you ask him about I felt like I was talking to a friend and not a employee

name: John Bertram
text: the two photos I just added are false addvertisment... they told me I didn't win anything it was for new customers to get a 59.99 or less phone free to sign up.... the front says I won a prize from them she tells me all the dealers are different... but it has your name and address to present it to you... again with out reading the card she says its for new customers... i said it doesn't say that on this card the guy sitting there in the back tells me to stop sticking it in her face.. I told him she was sitting down behind the counter and I'm standing up behind the counter how you see I'm sticking it in her face he says let me see it and wads it up and heads for the trash can,,, when I asked what was he doing he says I'm throwing it away like I did 9 or 10 others today... I told him that was mine and I wanted it back he says of but you need to leave this store you didn't WIN anything.... the card plainly states the address of the store... and it plainly states to give it to them to get your prize... I was denied the prize and was told I read the card wrong and that not all dealers are the same... they tell me that every time i ask them a question... I WILL get that charger and I will see a lawyer about this A.S.A.P.  I am A PCS CUSTOMER!!! CARD DOES NOT STATE CUSTOMER OR NOT... SO BEING THAT I AM A PCS USER I'M AUTOMATICALLY NOT A WINNER OF ANYTHING BECAUSE IT WASN'T THERE MOUTHED RULES THAT ARE NOT STATED ON THIS CARD THAT SAYS I WON A CHARGER OR A SELFIE STICK... I WANT MY CHARGER !!!

Instead of trying to get me to buy the more expensive 1 she advised me that the cheaper 1 had better sound quality.  I will most definitely recommend this store to all my friends!!!

name: Barbara Scoggins
text:
I have no issues with this store or employees. Store was clean and taken care of, employee was extremely helpful and took care of us with no problem.
However my issue is with Boost, starting about 10 days ago I was and still am being hacked.  It is something Boost knew and knows of.  Instead of warning their customers they chose to keep quiet and do nothing!!! So now I have to take our phones to a computer place see if they can by fixed. Not looking good...and now I found out that this very post and all my others posts had something to do with our being hacked. More to come if they allow it.

name: Dee Rowe
text: Quinta and her coworker (so sorry I forgot your name) went over and above to help me today. They were so kind. And patient. I’m not young and I get confused. Solving my problem was not easy or quick but they both got the job done. You rock!

name: Jennifer Clemmons
text: Went to turn in my equipment,  there we 2 employees and each had a customer.  I'm holding the medium sized box with one arm in a cast. No one spoke to me. Finally I put the box on a table and waited for my turn. One employee left the room and came back with the manager (?). She apologized for my wait and proceeded to scan my equipment. I was 2 days late returning it and got a bill for $223. I asked her if she could prorate it for just 2 days. She smiled  and told me the charge would be credited back to me within 24 hours. She was very nice and appreciative about how I boxed the equipment.  It was a good enough experience even with my arm in a cast. I left happy and the only reason I disconnected our cable and internet was because we don't really watch TV much anymore.  Our internet was iffy at best. You could work on your phone but if you moved or turned over it had to think about it too often and long. I got a move- in special for 1 year. Each service was $44.99.

name: Beth Glover
text: Jana Burks at the Dothan Spectrum store made my equipment exchange easy and non painful. She was very friendly and professional. I was in and out in under 10 minutes.

name: Karen Creel
text: Service was awesome!! Thanks y'all!! We're absolutely loving our WIfi. Only issue I have had is navigating the website & app. The error message states unavailable in my area or something to that nature.

text: if they wont answer their business phone during regular business hours, im sure as hell not going to drive there to ask a question. great head start on crappy customer service

name: Mildred Browley
text: When I started my service at MetroPCS here at this location I purchased a phone  one day and I paid out of pocket  $160  the phone I purchase  was supposedly free  and I end up paying $30 for the phone  never got a refund  the next day  I went back  and purchased a new phone  at $59 I paid out of pocket for activation fee  and for switching devices I paid $170 I went back about a week ago to get my phone reset back 2 Factory settings the young lady told me that she couldn't unlock it because I have put my password in too many times and I would have to purchase a new phone when I called MetroPCS the gentleman on the phone gave me instructions on how to unlock the phone and reset it I was very happy but I have a problem with the employees at this location and they have had multiple complaints about them they need to be reported to MetroPCS

name: Meems
text: The customer service is excellent!!  They do the best they can with the service they provide especially in such rural areas!!  We are thankful for them!

name: Chris Rudolph
text: Paid for my internet to be installed over a week ago and still haven’t had my internet installed! They even called my saying they were going to install it one day and they never showed up and never called me. I have called multiple times and they keep coming up with excuses and LIES! Customer service is a joke and the company is a joke. New owners and management needed!!!

name: Water The Field
text: Waiting for a Refund, it take 60 days for a Refund.

name: Keelan Moore
text: Millry Communications really need to get it together. As almost everyone has already said, their “internet” is the most pathetic excuse of such that I’ve ever seen. Especially after dark, when the traffic picks up. Here’s an idea, UPGRADE YOUR EQUIPMENT! There are ways to keep up with the demand! I can understand losing a small amount of performance at peak times. But I’ve been running speed tests when I have the most trouble, and more often than not, the 6mbps connection that I pay for (excessively pay for at that) is more often than not running at LESS than 1mbps. One day another ISP option is going to come along and all these dissatisfied customers are going to drop you without a second thought.

name: Trashee Treasures
text: The absolute worst internet EVER!!! And the customer service stinks!! They know it and don't care because its not like you have another option for service.

name: Bonnie Everett
text:
The internet is constantly out and the issue never gets resolved.  They have replaced the modem at least 15 times. They ran a new wire above the ground didn’t fix the problem. We now have a wire running through the window and still the internet goes out.  When i called to speak with the owner of the company i was told he would not speak to me. I am a paying customer and deserve better that this backwoods ignorant owner of Millry Communications. I will be initiating a grievance with the BBB to at least get our bill prorated for all the outages  that we have incurred. Also i will consult with a lawyer to start a class action suit against Millry Communications so that we the community get what we are paying for.

Fed up with ignorance

name: Jason Savage
text: It always goes out and is slow. Really not worth what I am paying.

name: Carpenter and Sons
text: It's been two weeks since I signed paperwork to request service and I still have yet to receive service. First hurdle was consent to dig on my land that was previously resolved. Due to there own negligence the paperwork was lost. I have not had the first call explaining when service would start. There has been no customer service interaction as well but this is expected with a monopoly.

name: Clare
text: The internet is NOT worth the money. They also will not allow you to just have internet, instead of having a landline too. Maybe it's because I'm too used to having internet without one, but I feel like it's a bit crazy that I have to pay $120 monthly for spotty internet, and a phone I don't even use. :(

name: BaDBILLYGunn GAMES
text: Lack of customer service..the women know nothing about their own job it's sad. It's almost as if they don't give a sh**. They should let the man of Internet service run the company. He seems to care..

name: Griffiths
text:
Best I can say is they "offer" internet. Had it for about 8 years now. It has constantly gone out. After the first 4 years of having their techs come out and "check" the equipment, just for them the reset the modem(same thing I do), I quit calling them when service goes out. It is less stressful to just wait a few hours for it to come back on, than to waste your time dealing with them.

The price is absolutely insane for the speeds we get. Currently paying around $45 for 6.0 MBS. What's worse, I don't even get the full 6.0, I am lucky most days if I can get 3.0 MBS

name: Jarrett Turner
text: I find it pretty ridiculous that a simple 33Gb update on a PS4 game takes 4 days to update because of your terrible internet. If xfinity or some big internet company was to work in this area millry communications would go out of business in a couple hours...

name: Chaun Davis
text: In the words of the "tech" the outage wasn't an outage......

name: Laced Kentucky
text: Umm where do I start, this internet is not worth any money. I think it’s very sad that I have to connect to my hotspot if I play my PS4. I wouldn’t let my dog use this internet it’s so baddddddd like trash just stop making internet😁

name: Timothy Brown

text: I was in here the other day to upgrade my phone because they were advertising a trade in deal. I removed the screen protector in front of them and it was flawless I took the case off and it was dusty but also flawless. So I end up trying to work something else out while the entire time feeling disrespected. Then 2 ladies walk in and they also get the same treatment I got. It got to the point where I got so mad I just said forget it and left. I went to the att store across from walmart and did exactly what I was going to do there with no issues the lady helping me and all other store employees were very courteous. They agreed that my phone was flawless and they just didn't want to do the long process to get me a new one. I wont be back and they need new employees. name: Nelson Jancaterino
text:
I went in Saturday for my free upgrade to the Samsung 9 note. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and i have to admit they have a great taste in music. The sales associate was still new to the system so it took a little longer than normal, but he was very nice and we've all been there with a new job so it was cool. The assistant manager was extremely knowledgeable and thorough when explaining the new lease, and i have to say a great teacher when it came to helping the new sales associate, which i very much appreciated, and the store manager was also engaging as helpful and nice to his staff.

While i was there, a customer came in fairly aggravated at another store and i could tell he wanted to take it out on the sprint store folks. All the members of the sales team calmly and politely answered his questions, and treated him with respect. They answered his questions and he left a little less aggravated.
Other customers who came in seemed to know the employees very well and the employees knew them. It was almost like being at one of those old mom and pop stores where everyone knows one another.

All in all it was a great experience and i will choose this location, and sprint, from now on.

name: Drew Holloman
text: By far the best Sprint store I've visited. We went in on a Friday, the day the iPhone Xs and Xs Max were shipped. Malcolm was very helpful as well as Quentin. Malcolm assisted my in choosing the best screen protector for her new phone as well as a good reliable case. They setup the liquid glass on her screen and even registered it for her as well. Great customer service. Malcolm even assisted me with the questions I had about my phone and working on my upgrade. The next day, he called and asked how the phone setup had went and he even informed me of what I would pay out of pocket for my damage fee and being able to proceed with pre-ordering my iPhone Xs Max. This was the very next day, Saturday. Malcolm called us that following Tuesday to let me know that my phone had arrived. Later that day after work, I went in and also had liquid glass installed and new case. The activation and transfer process was quick and easy. Again, great customer service from Malcolm and the team at this Sprint store.

resp.text: Hey Bobby, we’re sorry you had to wait and we want to figure out how we can make things better for you!  At T-Mobile we offer many self service options to pay your bill so you won’t have to wait.  You can pay your bill online through the T-Mobile app, on the web at T-Mobile.com, or over the phone by dialing 611 from your T-Mobile device.  If you would like to pay in the store and have a reduced wait you can always schedule an appointment online at https://www.t-mobile.com/store-locator as many of our customers do.  Please call me at 256-301-1830 so we can chat!

name: Karen Mizzell
text:
On a Sunday afternoon we had 3 phones to update...one which had been lost. What should have been a simple process  turned into a long drawn out deal bc one of the phones had never been backed up or updated in years so there was a lot of manual work that had to be done.

Bre who was the only associate in the store was extremely friendly and very professional. After about 20 minutes of us working, there were numerous customers that came in and she took care of everyone so efficiently and professionally!  We were there almost 3 hours and Bre never stopped, complained or panicked but was calm and efficient.

I would recommend her and this store to anyone! Thanks for such a refreshingly wonderful experience!

name: Michelle Maher (Michelle Maher-Williams)
text:
I accidentally left a review yesterday for this location under another name, so Bre is probably wondering who in the world that person is because she doesn’t remember helping them 😂 So in the spirit of continuity, this review is for my niece, Maddie.
My Dad took my niece to AT&T in Chelsea earlier today to get a SIM card for her phone and to add her to his plan.  I messaged him to have Bre help them, since she did such a good job getting me the phone that I wanted (the iPhone 11) and saving me a good bit of money on my monthly bill. I needn’t have worried, because Bre was on the ball and already helping them. In fact, she had just gotten my niece a great deal on a new phone and airbuds.  My niece really liked my new phone, the iPhone 11, and she’s been wanting airbuds ever since they came out, so she is beyond thrilled with the sale. I recommend this location 100% and my sister is heading there tomorrow!

name: Zeke Fason
text: I've always had a bit of trouble with at&t, but today, when I went to the Chelsea store. Bre helped me out, and she was honestly one of the most helpful at&t workers that has ever worked with me.

text: My husband and I went to the AT&T store in Chelsea to upgrade our phones. What is usually a long and miserable experience was made very pleasurable by Gage who was very knowledgeable, personable, and patient downloading thousands of pictures from my old phone and setting us up on our new ones. Thanks so much Gage! Well done!

name: Carol Shelton
text: In and out quickly

name: Amelia Landers
text: My husband, mother-in-law, and I had a horrible experience for the first time at this AT&T location. We went in to upgrade a couple of phones and the sales lady that was in there (unfortunately we did not get her name) was extremely rude. When we first went in there, my husband was trying to explain to her what we were there for and the whole time he’s talking to her, she’s on a personal FaceTime call. And might I add, she asked my husband for his phone number and PIN number to our account while on the phone with that person which I’m quite sure goes against their privacy policy. But to make matters worse, she had a very bad attitude and snarky remarks with my husband and mother-in-law while talking trade-in value of phones. Needless to say we left and did not do business there today and we will no longer do business as long as she works there.

resp.text: Hi Amelia! We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates. We will work with our employees to ensure you are provided with the customer service you deserve. We’d like to learn more about your recent experience – could you please email us at customerservice@primecomms.com?

To make a long story short Blue was already on it when I walked into the store this morning. My suggestion,  look elsewhere.

text: This establishment is a joke. My mother's phone was set to Spanish language somehow.  She took the phone back in and was told there was nothing they could do to convert it back to English. Fast forward, my mother called me, I googled the words in Spanish to get her into the the languages so that she could select English as her primary language.  This is an example of poor quality customer service.  If it were not for me, she would have been out of more money for no reason.  I would advise anyone to think twice before getting service with this establishment.  The only good quality you receive is when you exchange money from your hand to theirs.  Otherwise a waste of service. Please go someplace else.

text: What a great experience I had at this T-Mobile location.  I had originally purchased a phone from the Florence location for my daughter and it started having issues on day one.  We took it back to that location 2 times and of course they did their diagnostic tests on it, reset it twice and then sent us on our way.  Apparently i got a "bad APPLE" because none of this fixed the problems.  Fed up with this location, I decided to visit the Muscle Shoals location.  Let's just say that this will be my "go to" store going forward.  I was greeted by Nicole and she was absolutely amazing.  She presented the issues we were having to her manager "Trinidad" I think was his name and he agreed that the phone was bad.  They didn't have that exact color of phone in stock so she asked if I would be willing to drive to the Decatur store to get one.  I said yes so then she proceeded to call that location and told them everything.  She set everything up with a rep at that store and we swapped the phone out.  Thanks for listening to our problems and handling it professionally!  You guys rock!

name: Ryan Moore
text: So I went into the store at 6:40 PM and they were closing at 7 PM which is something I normally don’t do to people. I really needed to get my phone issue taken care of though. During the process of trying to get my phone active and getting my plan started we ran into several obstacles that required multiple calls to other departments inside of AT&T. Not once did I sense any frustration or irritability because these calls where having to be made and by this time it was past seven. Actually I was the one being told thank you for my patience even though these guys were staying past closing. Christine and Greg gladly stayed until 8pm making sure but I was taken care of. This may be hands-down the best customer service I’ve ever received. Anyone who’s fortunate enough to have Christine or Greg help them when they go in to the Auburn AT&T store I promise you’ll be just as pleased!

resp.text:

Thank you so much! We sincerely make sure that the customers needs are put first in every situation. name: Austin McAdory
text:
The 5 stars are for Jermaine, the man who spent 2 hours and 14 minutes of his life dutifully fighting through AT&T's abysmal phone system yesterday on my behalf.  It is only because of Jermaine that my simple number port - from an AT&T landline to an AT&T cell phone, which is supposed to take around 20 minutes - is even complete at all.  His diligent slogging through 9 phone support personnel from 5 different departments, including 4 different people from "Porting Activations" (which is apparently based somewhere in Russia...) made us both laugh, and nearly cry, and turned what would have been a soul crushing experience into something I will look back on mostly fondly.

I cannot recommend T-Mobile highly enough after all this, but if you choose AT&T (or if you're contractually glued to them), do yourself a HUGE favor and go see Jermaine at this location if you need any changes made that involve changes to your account itself.

(Note: the other 3 CSRs there all seem very nice too, but I dealt with Jermaine and this is mostly a review of his performance, which was excellent.  Don't let this discourage you from trying one of the others, though.)

P.S. I've noticed some other reviewers say you should try the Tigertown store.  I've been there twice, including earlier in the day yesterday, and they were zero help.  YMMV but this is an official company store, and Tigertown is a re-seller, so I'd seriously consider going here instead.  PLUS THE OTHER STORE DOESN'T HAVE JERMAINE!

name: Avery Arthur
text:
VERY DISAPPOINTED SO FAR
I ordered AT&T Uverse Internet last week and revived my self install package on time. However, due to problems with the lines, my service activation appointment was pushed back two days to resolve the issues. When I called for an update, I was told that the problem had been fixed and that I would be able to install my service after 2:00pm on the new activation date that I was quoted. I followed the instructions and installed my modem, as directed. After waiting an hour for the modem to start up, I still have no broadband service. After speaking with multiple customer service technicians, being told my issues were already resolved more than once, and spending DAYS of my own personal time trying to gain Internet access, I have been informed that I am to pay a technician much more money than I have at my disposal so that he or she might come out and fix the problem for me. If I had the funds to pay for a technician to install my service, I would not have purchased a self-install package. As a result of AT&T's failure to follow through on their promises, my personal life has been hindered, and my work has been delayed well past deadlines. As I stated before, I am extremely disappointed with AT&T.

name: Max Cichon
text:
I find it remarkable that anyone has posted a 5-star review of this place. I've been a wireless customer of AT&T for 12 years and when this place popped up near my work, I decided to use it to replace my upgefukked LG G3.
Big mistake. I cracked the screen, first time ever, and went back to this location and was told, basically I was out of luck. I didn't take the insurance. What insurance? It was never mentioned nor offered.
OK. My bad. I went to 3 different repair centers, non-AT&T, and was quoted ~$100 at each place. After a lengthy wait at each place (7-10 days) I was told the screen on this LG G35 ThinQ was different in camera location from any screens they could get.
Hmmmm...
I went to "first-in-town" AT&T store and was told, and I quote: "...oh. Those stores aren't really AT&T stores. They are "Authorized Re-sellers, only. You should have come here. We don't even sell the G35."
I returned, once again, to the re-seller and we had a Come to Jesus Meeting. I'm big and was pretty TO'ed. They agreed to get it repaired, at my cost, by sending it to LG in Ft. Worth TX. They did fix it. $152.

In short: do NOT use these "re-seller" stores. They are akin to "Big Lots". And have the same policies regarding customer service.

name: Jamie Leblanc
text:
I have to say the only good thing that comes from this provider are the 2 technicians I have had over the last four years and 2 customer support employees. We pay for 4mbps and for download we get 2 if that and upload is always less then 1mbps.  .7 mbps upload is as high as we normally get most of the time it's far less. Even after complaining multiple times, we where finally told the hardware for our area is to old to give us anymore then what we are getting. The employee who told us this also said the company was supposed to upgrade the equipment over 3 years back but never did. After learning this I thought about how much they have charged me over the years and never actually provided me with what they said.
I would not recommend using this provider if you can afford not to.

resp.text: Hi Jamie, we are very sorry for the trouble you've experienced. We'd like to look into this further and help. Please email us at social@consolidated.com. Thank you!

text: I wish I could give 0 stars! Unfortunately CenturyLink is the only internet provider where I live and the service is HORRIBLE! And don't bother contacting their customer service...you can't even get through or if you are lucky (or unlucky) enough to get through, they don't know how to help you. I work from home and I cannot stay connected to my software programs. With such terrible reviews, if CenturyLink actually cared about their customers, they would upgrade their network! I do not recommend them to anyone! If you have another choice for an internet provider go with anyone else but them!

name: Jessica Lord
text: RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN FROM THIS COMPANY! We have been double billed for several months.The company does not seem to care, have not made any adjustments to our bill, and I have spent countless time on the phone to try to get the bill adjusted to the correct bill. I am reporting them to the better business bureau. Save yourself the time and money, this company is a fraud and they just think they can continue to get away with it.

name: casey adam
text: Worst internet provider I have ever dealt with. Wish I could give them 0 stars. Internet is incredibly slow.  We pay for 40 down and get barely 1 down. Customer service is the worst. You will stay on the phone for hours, then they will tell you there are no outages in the area and it’s our fault.  We have to prove them wrong over and over again for them to retract their statement and send a tech. Once they set up a time for the tech, they cancel the tech visit without notifying us, saying it’s been resolved when nothing was resolved. We absolutely do not recommend this company to anyone at all, and if there was another option in our area we would switch to them in a heartbeat. What they do and how they treat their customers should be illegal.

name: DJ Johnston
text: Horrible service, have had to call multiple times to customer support which did NOT HELP AT ALL because they don’t even know what their technicians really do. Had multiple appointments for technicians to show up, 3 out of the 5 times they did not show up but still had the audacity to send messages even though the business was closed after 7. We have had to tell them EXACTLY what was wrong for them to even send a technician to look at the problem. It has been over 20 days since we have had internet, the problem was simply a cable was cut during roadside construction. If I could give them a 0/5 star rating I would. Don’t try to get this service, they will argue with you when you have a problem with the service like an OUTAGE, they have a very outdated system that makes you wait forever anytime you request their services. I would never want anybody to have to waste their precious time with this disgusting company.

name: markus rivers
text: This place is a rip off. Not only do they not provide better internet for rural areas (1.5 Mbps is 2005 speed its 2021...) but then they try to offer you HughesNet "Affiliate" Satellite Internet which is not a valid compromise considering you're paying the same money as DSL for more latency. I've realized most people are stuck with them not by choice. GET IT TOGETHER CENTURYLINK.

name: GiGi Travel Blogs
text:
I had to go into the store to do an in-person verification. Even after handing the store manager my CDL, the system the store utilizes told me  I wasn't the person I said I am and it indicated I did not live at the address where I stated on my application.

I drove over 45 miles from Birmingham to the Springville location (because that's where the online application sent me to) to be given the run around. I cancelled that order and went to T-Mobile and purchased both service and the new iPhone ProMax 256G. Based on my experience, I will never ever purchase anything from AT&T in the future.

name: GiGi Reviews
text: I live in Birmingham, Alabama. . . . I completed an online application for AT&T new service iPhone ProMax 156G-bits. The application online sent me to Springville, Alabama to the AT&T Store. I am suppose to do a "curbside" pickup. I had a note to call Customer Service before going to the Springville Store. I called CS and the Rep. stated there was missing information on my application. So, he canceled the order because I said I would visit the nearest AT&T Store in Hueytown. The Hueytown AT&T Store did not have the iPhone ProMax phone I had intended to purchase. Therefore, I did not do an application for a new account in the Hueytown Store. I proceeded on to drive 43 miles to the AT&T Store in Springville, Alabama. I arrive at the store and stated I was there to do an application for new service. I hand the Store Manager my driver's license as proof of identity and residence. The manager keyed in the information from my CDL and AT&T Opulence Systems kept kicking the information out stating I wasn't who I am.👀 #ThatsOdd So and for about 20-30 minutes the Store's Manager tried to key in my information until the District Manager called and notified the Store Manager the AT&T Opulence System was having issues processing applications online. Therefore, I utilized my cellular phone to submit again an application for new service and the portal was unstable, flipping through pages before the end-user could complete the online application. However, the application went through and stated the phone would be delivered to my home by April 2021 👀👀👀 At that point, I believed this was an indication I should not patronize AT&T for cellular services. #OrderCanceled4Good

resp.text: Hello GiGi Reviews We do our best to equip our team to assist our customers. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers! We're sorry we fell short of your expectations. Please contact the area manager bryan.hale@liveatt.com so we can find a resolution for you.

text: At this location, one of the employees, Tamika, recognized a scam artist was trying to take advantage of an elderly family member on our plan. Because of Tamika's quick thinking to call me, our family was able to find out that indeed, our elderly family member was being scammed. We cannot thank Tamika enough for going above and beyond to help us! It is employees like this who make Metro a company our family trusts! Tamika was looking out for our elderly family member, and made us aware of something that we had no knowledge of. THANK YOU Metro and THANK YOU, Tamika! Our family is eternally grateful!

text: Working with Slappey has been one of the best decisions I've made in the past year.  Most companies I've worked with either don't service their own hardware (subcontract service out to a 3rd party) or have the expertise to make your phone work seamlessly with your other office technology. Slappey has been excellent as they service all of their own equipment. Plus, I now have a local person I can get on the phone rather than calling an 800 number and getting stuck in limbo.

name: Pat Reid
text:
Great company and great people.

When working with a MSP often times you feel like a customer. With Slappey and their team I feel like I truly have a partner.

Ownership of a process to resolution is a great example where they shine.

Some folks look for the best price. Some the willingness to adapt to their business processes. I personally looks for integrity. Slappey has earned my business on all three points.

Patrick Reid
IT Manager
Royal Cup Coffee & Tea

text: Leslie was wonderful and so helpful in figuring out exactly what my business needed and the phones system they installed is fantastic. name: Studio 21 Salon and Boutique
text:
I'm 7 months into a contract with this company for BASIC phone and internet service and the system is  down again today!!!  So far the service has been down a minimum of once a month since we signed our agreement.  Each time the service goes down it's always the fault of "AT&T" or "the equipment is faulty" or some other excuse.  To make matters worse EVERY time it goes down it's down for hours!!

Not once has there been any solutions offered until I started sending letters requesting to discontinue my service without penalty.  And here we are again...service down and the technician has no answers for me.

Do your business a favor....go anywhere else but this company for reliable phone and internet service...

resp.text:
Dana,

I'm so sorry to hear you are having a bad experience with Slappey.  This is certainly not the type of reference we've built in our 34 years of business and would like for you to have the same great experience all of our customers enjoy.  We understand that a redundant solution was offered to your company by our service team at no charge to you (so you aren't affected when AT&T has issues).  Perhaps you were not personally aware of this offer, but we would strongly encourage you to allow Slappey to implement this solution to make sure we eliminate the impact of any AT&T outages.

If you do need further assistance, our President is always willing to get involved and come meet you to discuss how we can make sure you have the great service that our company is founded on.

Thanks,
Slappey Team

text: Deceptive practices, bait and switch phone price. They will tell you anything to get you to run a credit check. After they have run a credit check they will not honor the price point they have marked in the store. They assume you will accept anything, since they have run a credit check. I cancelled the transaction, however they still charged me $33.00 for sim cards I do not have, and were to refund, but they did not. The company as a whole is deceptive. They don't care about YOU...the customer. The agent named Jason was rude, and inept. He blatantly lied to me. He refused to call a supervisor, stating they were unavailable. Then, when he was not even able to to cancel my transaction, low and behold he stepped to the back and called them on his cell phone and the walked him through cancelling my account. However they still have not refunded me. When I call TMobile main number, all I was given was a written address to submit my complaints to.

If you are trying to switch or just looking for a new cell company this is the company and Shakeria's Metro is the place. Also, I would like to say that her boss Sarah was extremely helpful and they both were sensitive to the situation!

text: Went to upgrade a line for my daughter who already had an IPAD with cell service. When I called ATT they said this was all false and that line could have been upgraded in the store - otherwise was lied to. Then on top of that, I see an email a day later that I was enrolled in ATT's overpriced insurance plan for that new iphone and phone line without my knowledge. Buyer be wary with EVERYTHING they tell you!!!

I ended the phone call very pleased with my appt time and Jamie’s calmness and positivity made the phone call much better for my stress and worries! name: Jason Smithy
text:
If I could give 0 stars to "Xcelerate" I absolutely would. Denver/Colorado residents ENSURE any potential place you will be moving into - DOES NOT require the use of xcelerate. If it does, run FAR away. You will encounter NO service after paying the highest prices in the country for internet... and it will be 5pm.. and you will call... and there will be a voicemail option only. These people should be out of business. Hence why they've changed their name 100 times - abhorrent reputation. Please go out of business already so customers do not continue to suffer!

Edit: the reply from “the owner” tells you all you need to know. Run!! I’m sure my billing statements with super high internet charges every month and my bank account statements showing the payments to Xcelerate have no merit either 🤣🤣🤣🤣

text: Only took a day from the time I called to the time my technician finished setting up my internet. Incredibly fast and incredibly easy. Best customer service I've had in a while

name: Lisa Kelly
text: I never leave reviews (in fact, this is my first one) but felt compelled to because I had no idea why Xcelerate Networks had all of these negative reviews. I live in a complex with over 300 units, and not once have I had an issue with internet speeds or my DIRECTV service. Most of the negative reviews I read are very simple fixes that if these people actually called to get the problem fixed, I'm sure it would be in a heartbeat. The lady I called to set up my internet service (wish I caught her name) was so kind and helpful. But like with most businesses, it is way more common to leave a review for a bad experience than it is for someone satisfied with their service. People love to complain lol

resp.text: Wow, Lisa. Thank you for being so kind. We love to hear from our customers!

By far the worst company I have ever had dealing with internet, if its not down its horribly slow packet loss at 40 or above, never getting close to the speeds they advertise... if I was you trust me when I say use Hotspot its guaranteed to be better

So after contacting them multiple times about my internet they tell me that 50 percent packet loss is normal, im not  sure how they hire these rude and uneducated workers but this company deserves to be blacklisted. Horrible service horrible connection and horrible employees.

If this is not the case, please contact our customer service team to report the issue. As a courtesy, we will have a representative reach out to you today to follow-up and assist you.

I cant even stream things on hulu with out it buffering none stop. if they just fix the speeds and ping spikes I would in joy it much more.

resp.text: Thank you for your review and for the kind words about our customer service reps. We are doing every thing we can to resolve the issue. Please know that you can call our team at any time.

name: Dalton “The one” West
text:
Called and scheduled an appointment directly after install due to internets speeds being lower then advertised even after buying the upgraded plan and here we are 3 hours later absolutely no internet...

The technician was in and out and the customer service rep was sweet and the only positive out of any of this. As of 10/29 no service.

resp.text: Mr. Coffman, our records indicate that our technician came into your home and ran several speed tests. A detail note on your account references photos, which indicate our services were working properly when the technician left your home. The wireless router was replaced immediately to rule out an equipment issue, and he ran additional  speed test to insure your services were working as promised. The technician shared these speed tests and photos with your brother, as you were not at home during the time of the appointment. If you are still experiencing problems, we will be happy to resend a technician to help tomorrow, but you must be present for the appointment. We take our service very seriously and want to insure our customers receive quality service. We are locally owned an operated and take pride in providing friendly, kind and knowledgable local support. Please feel free to call us anytime and we will do our best to address your issue immediately.

name: Marley B
text: Technician was very helpful during installation and walked me through how to use all of the equipment. All my questions were answered before he left and I've had no issues so far!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! We are happy to hear that you are satisfied with your experience. Please let us know if we can help you in the future.

text: I have nothing but the best things to say about the management and the employees regarding contracts and buildouts with this company.  As a professional, this company goes above and beyond for their clients, residents, and potential clients EVERYTIME.  There are no other professional companies I would rather work with than the Xcelerate Team!  They are available 24/7 whenever I need them and always produce professional, responsible and competitive work while thinking outside the box for the clients at all times.  I highly respect this organization and the management they have working for them.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and feedback. We value our customers and the partnership with the properties we serve!

name: Cody Grant
text: This company has been top notch. When I had some recent issues, I spoke with Jamie and she was able to help me navigate through my concerns/issues. I am very happy witht the customer service and would recommend this service.

name: America’s CEO
text:
Most recent update: I’ve been meaning to update for a week or so. We have finally got all my issues fixed. My signal flows through my whole apartment. Speeds are decent enough to allow me to stream without constantly buffering. The issue was they switched routers they were using and found out that the ones they were using just wasn’t up to par with the tp link they have now. Everything is great now and I have the wonderful folks that work in the office to thank. She definitely wanted my issue fixed and we’ve finally gotten to that point.
I even get a strong connection on my balcony! Well deserved 5 star review. Thanks for dealing with me til the end!

resp.text: Great! I am glad that you are satisfied with your experience. We pride ourselves on superior customer service and look forward to being your service provider.

text: My experience with Xcelerate Networks was terrific. The customer service is exceptional and Candice was extremely helpful.

text: I hate this cable service.  I have lived at my apt for 7 months and just these last 2 months my cable goes out for a day or 2 at a time. It's bright and sunny out and yet the cable does not work.  I call the local office no answer and have to leave a voicemail. I don't understand how the cable goes out every other week all day and weather is not an issue. I would give this 0 stars if I could.  Currently cable is out as we speak and has been for several hours 😠😠😡😡

text: Great service. Not sure why there are so many bad reviews, but we have had quality service and great response when dealing with Xcelerate. Great local staff that adds a personal touch.

text: Didn't have to be on hold for an hour+ to get my service set up – happy with the customer service!

name: J
text:
I have Xcelerate internet through my apartment complex City Heights Hoover. The WiFi is CONSTANTLY going out! This is the 2nd time this week the internet is out. I’ve had my internet go out countless times within the few years I’ve been living here. Xcelerate customer service will make you wait for other calls from the neighborhood call in to make the issue prioritized and send someone out to fix the problem. It’s also a Sunday so I will not be having my internet fixed today. With this kind of service they need technical support on call everyday of the week.
This is a ONGOING issue for the past 2 and half years!

resp.text: Thank you for your message. There is an ongoing house power problem on your property. We are using a temporary source until we are provided with a stable power source. We have a technician on call, but unfortunately power problems cannot be resolved without onsite staff in place.

name: Andy Curry
text: This company can be a real hassle to deal with. I am unable to swap to a different ISP due to the contract with my apartment complex, and so I have tried to make Xcelerate work as best as I can, but the road has just been too bumpy to leave a positive review.  Its really hard to get a clear answer from tech support, and sometimes they have claimed that nothing is wrong on their end.  I tracked packet loss and determined, multiple times, that the problem is absolutely on their end.  I just want a stable connection, it can even be slow for all I care.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience. Our records indicate that you do not have an account with Xcelerate. We will be happy to help in any way we can. Please contact our office with your account information and we will do our best to resolve the issue as quickly as possible.

text: Apparently "50 down and 10 up" really means 7 down and 42 up?? I lost track of how many service requests I have put in with these people to provide the internet promised. Not sure why anyone would want this. Also shout out to Southside Apartment Company for forcing you to get service through them. Good move.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Our lead Field Services Supervisor will contact you momentarily. According to our records, you are using a device that was owned by a previous resident. We recommend purchasing a router that is up to date and allows the maximum amount of bandwidth to your connected devices.

text: MOST HORRIBLE CABLE COMPANIES OUT HERE
