text: Jennifer has a terrible attitude and does not respect her customers. Worst customer service ever!

resp.text: Mr. Foshee, I apologize that you had a bad experience. However, we do not have a customer service representative by the name of Jennifer nor do we have any record(s) of you having an account with us. We will be happy to assist you. Please call our office at 855.442.4908.

name: Rob Masters
text: If you enjoy having your slow internet just sometimes cut off on you completely, and also want a horrible website that offers you next to nothing as far as customer service or important information goes, this is the internet for you!

name: Dennis Jemison
text: This is most definitely the worst service ISP I have ever had the burden of dealing with. I’m forced to use it since it’s contracted with my apartment complex. The service is god awful, with frequent ping spikes and pack loss for several minutes at a time. Currently I am in the midst of one of their frequent periods where their service just becomes unusable on anything. It’s been like this for more than a week now. The last time this happened I tried calling for help, and was placed on hold for hours. I do not recommend this service if you have a choice, it will be the worst decision of your life.

resp.text: Mr. Jemison we appreciate your feedback. It would be most helpful if you would contact our office in order to assist you. One of our friendly staff members will be happy to assist you.

name: Clayton S
text:
I couldn't ask for better service! The speed and consistency is top-notch (both internet and customer service)!

If you're looking for an ISP with a personal feel, this is it.

name: Andrue Ham
text: I've been using this service for almost a year now, the problems I have started 5 months ago and have yet to be fixed. Originally we had problems with high ping. We kept calling customer service and got no help, always being asked to reset the router. Finally, we got a technician to come out and he was the friendliest guy and apologized about the problems. After he left, it was fine for a week. Then came to constant loss of connection to the DNS servers. Literally every 10 to 15 minutes the internet would just lose connection for a minute then back on. This has been on going for months. Bless the customer service staff because  I'm sure there isnt much they can do, but I feel like I'm getting no help from anyone. Speed isn't my worry, its stability and I cant get that.

resp.text: Mr. Ham, thank you for your feedback. At this time, we are unable to locate an account in your name. Please contact our office at 855-442-4908 and someone will be happy to assist you.

name: Tazier Medaken
text: The employees are constantly uninformed there is always some outage or some other reason they can't do their job or takes them multiple days to find out when the internet will even be up again there have been a couple real nice employees but even then my internet takes forever to come back on. Just give charter the actual business rather than you just borrowing their infrastructure.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words about our employees. At this time, we do not have the name above as a registered customer in our system. However, we apologize for any service interruption that you have experienced. Kindly call our office and update your contact information, and we will restore your services as quickly as possible.

name: Danielle Everett
text: I had to call multiple times and schedule multiple appointments because the people that initially answered the phones were pretty terrible. However, the company's real customer service rep was nice, accommodating, and helpful. And the actual technician, Marcus, was amazing! He came by after hours to fix my internet issue and really went above and beyond to get my internet working again. I hate that I had to deal with incompetent people just to get to the company's real employees but they still deserve 5 stars.

name: Jeffery Winborne
text:
One star is entirely too kind of a rating for this "company". Continuous failure to provide reliable service and even worse customer service. This company continues to exist only because they have contracts with local apartments complexes as they offer cheap alternatives to actual quality services. It is a shame that people like myself are forced to continue to rely on them.

Update: I finally gave up on the tv service ever working so I sent my HD DVR back to DirecTV and now just stream everything. (I'd rather pay for something that works.) The internet was "serviceable", but apparently since switching to AT&T as the primary provider (I can tell this due to the change from Spectrum to AT&T Enterprise in the Speedtest app and because I know one of the AT&T techs that hooked it up), I cant stream anything for more than 5-10 minutes at a time without it dropping connection. All of my Roku apps are dropping, my phone wont even load a web page at least 3/4 of a time. I'm not sure why the change, but it has made it exponentially worse. I just want internet that works.   :-(

resp.text: Mr. Winborne thank you for your feedback. We see that you are scheduled for a trouble ticket for your DTV service, not internet. I am also happy to notify you that we are currently in the process providing a fiber circuit to the property. Update: It has just been confirmed that your service was out due to a house power problem on the property. We do not have the ability to control powering issues onsite. We appreciate your business and have a wonderful day!

name: Marsha Lynn
text: When we have had  an issue,or problem with tv or internet  service it was very hard to get in touch with them to notify them of the problem. I would Leave messages, and send messages to them on their website, and it took me calling my landowner to get in touch with them ....UPDATED :a year later December 2018, Today my husband spoke to Jamie and she was very informative and nice. She done an extraordinary job answering his questions and concerns. All stars for Jamie's Customer service.

name: David P
text: They have a monopoly on apartment communities so they don't care about quality of service or price. My apartment requires I pay $70 a month for cable and internet and that gets me 25mbps. I want to upgrade to the standard 100mbps that most companies offer. That's another $65 a month I have to pay Xcelerate separately. Talk about a RIPOFF. $135/mo for TV I don't want and competitive internet speeds. No wonder people hate this thieving company!!!

resp.text: Mr. David, we appreciate your feedback. I have talked to the owner of our company and we would like the work out something to insure you are satisfied with your service. Please contact our office as soon as possible and we will be happy to assist. Let our staff members know that you left a review in order to better assist you.

name: Kanyn Crawford
text: When I first began business with this company I requested the 30/10 mbps package which is supposedly an upgrade. I have since done 5 separate speed tests 5 different times and I have consistently gotten 5-9 mbps download speeds. This is ridiculous. I also can’t get anyone to answer the phone for me to request my service be downgraded. I don’t have time to sit on the phone for 30 minutes waiting for someone to answer. This is unacceptable, if the 10/10 package wasn’t included in my rent I wouldn’t even bother asking them to downgrade I’d just request the service be cancelled. This may possibly the be worst customer service I’ve ever seen.

resp.text: I apologize for the inconvenience. I understand that you were able to reach one of our representatives via email. We offer the convenience of leaving a voicemail in order to avoid wait times. We look forward to resolving your issue as quickly as possible.

name: Taylor Weems
text: XCELERATE NETWORKS IS THE WORST INTERNET I HAVE EVER HAD....AVOID THIS ISP AT ALL COSTS. My apartment lease states that I have contract with xcelerate, so there’s not hope of dropping and picking up a much more willing and helpful ISP! Constant packet loss, huge ping spikes ever 20 seconds with no end in sight. Their customer service is on par with the “service” they provide. No diagnostics, no help over the phone. When you call they ask if you reset your router/modem, if you did they try to blame you for “using too much internet”. Never have I received a refund for outage of internet. You call for help and they tell you your case has been moved up and a tech will call you soon, 50/50 chance you ever get a call. I’ve had techs come out on multiple occasions but never have they been able to actually fix anything. Techs claiming they are upgrading parts around the community, lived here for a year and internet has NEVER improved. Currently my internet is out and Netflix can’t get started over constant buffering. I’m not really sure how this company stays in business, must be nice piggy-backing off of spectrums model.

name: Brandon Taylor
text: They just provide slow service and in the year 2018 at the bare minimum 100 Mps should be available, however, for 50 Mps that’s inconsistent I’m paying an extra 30 dollars. The router is in my closet instead of a centralized location like my living room or even kitchen. Then when i asked can I get the router moved they said I would be charged for two different plans for the same apartment. It’s a money pit...it’s literally taking my Xbox 4 hours to download 50 GB in 2018. If the owner reads this than you should be ashamed to have such a incomprehensible service. I’ve been deployed to Iraq and there had been better internet connections than here at 79 commerce so beware. All I want is faster consistent speeds.

name: MPMN2016
text: I absolutely hate this company . .Can't wait to move so that I'm no longer stuck with them. .I've had nothing but problems since getting this company a year ago and I can't get rid of them because they have an exclusive contract with the apt. complex...  I had to call several times this week to be told by one of their reps that the company sold me what she calls"a middle of the road router" and it was only meant to last for a year but that i could purchase another from them for $70 to be installed next Wednesday.. I guess I must look like 10 shades of stupid...  Horrible company!!  If you are looking for reliable service and good customer service don't even think about using this company!! Smh

name: Change is Good
text: By far the worst company EVER! My boxes are crap they keep shutting down after every 3 minutes. They give you half tail service and want to charge you to come out and service their boxes. I can't wait until my lease is up and move.

name: Jamel Hardware
text:
Had more bad than good experiences with Xcelerate. Having to be forced to change in the complex I'm in back in 2013, I went from paying $30 for 30/15 with Charter to paying $30 for 10/5 with Xcelerate. Now Charter/Spectrum offers 200Mbps as their BASE speed in my area for $30 while Xcelerate doesn't offer anything competitive. I can't even get the speed I'm paying for consistently. Having 12+ devices on a home LAN over a 10Mbps connection sometimes feels like 56k. If you want to have bandwidth that's current with the times, make sure the next place you move into gives you ISP choices.

Update 12/5/19
At this point, it isn't about whether they can fix the problem in a timely manner or how friendly they are. It's the core problem of the overall reliability of their network infrastructure. Although I no longer have lengthy down-times to warrant a service call, I do have intermittent/unstable connection or what I like to say "hiccups", unstable bandwidth speeds - one day I could be at 13M the next day I would be <1M. Since it isn't a constant reproducible problem, it's hard to say whether a service call is necessary. Plus still not satisfied they don't have 100M+ speeds like other providers.

Update 6/22/20
Every time there's a power outage - whether it's from thunderstorms or transformers blowing up - the internet acts up with unstable connections or slow speeds just from browsing the web, all to warrant a tech visit. More infrastructure issues. Never had these issues with any other provider.

resp.text: Mr. Hardware we appreciate your feedback. We offer upgraded packages at all of the properties we serve, and residents can increase their bandwidth at any time.

name: Luke Frasier
text:
This review has been a long time coming. I’ve been forced to use this ISP by my apartment owner’s accommodations. Since day one I have had problems with my connection. The speed is not the problem but the quality and stability. From high ping issues to the internet being out an entire day until someone shows up locally. The 9-5 tech support is half the time friendly and half the time they sound annoyed. I was also told techs come out to my location Mon, Wed, Fri. What is that? Understaffed? On a lighter note, the tech that does come out is incredibly helpful but this company needs to do some serious upgrades to their hardware outside of these apartments. Why would I want to pay for something that has such constant interruptions of service? At least with the larger companies they come out after hours or actually have after hours tech support that are able to do something besides telling me to unplug my router. I would never refer this company to anyone. (This review is powered by my Information System: Networking degree)

Update: I have come back to change my review from 2 stars to 1. I constantly have to call after hours for internet issues and my speeds slowing down to 1MGb. I refused to be at the apartment to have someone come check it out after already missing time from work numerous occasions. The lady didn't like that and she was not friendly. This is a company that basically is refusing to update their hardware. The network is not stable. The speed is not the problem, I just want it to WORK. My iPhone's T-Mobile hotspot has a better and more stable connection. I've tested the ping spikes and compared to my hotspot it's ridiculous.  I've already informed the new property managers (bought last week) to drop this service and let us get charter/spectrum. Is it crazy to ask for decent internet service while living in the largest city in Alabama and one of the  most popular neighborhoods in the area???

resp.text: Mr. Frasier, we apologize that you are unhappy with your current service. We will have a staff member reach out to you as soon as possible. We make every effort possible to accommodate our customers schedule. We look forward to assisting you.

name: Carletta Davis
text: They seriously need to hire more people. Our internet has been going on an off since Monday, called today and was told the earliest they could send someone was next Tuesday. Today is Wednesday, that's a long time to wait for help. This isn't the first time this year there has been an outage or disconnects and I've had to wait several days for those as well. My apartment complex took a contract several years ago and it's unfair that I had to give up a better internet provider for what feels like an upstart company.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Davis. I apologize that you are experiencing an interruption in service. We are always happy to assist you. Please contact our office in order to escalate this issue.

name: James Duffy
text: This company is by far the worst internet provider I have ever had. I have had better connection speeds and customer service while deployed. The internet will randomly go out and then they claim it’s on my end when I can garuntee that it is not. I don’t have a choice of isp due to the contract with the apartment complex. When ever I call they always talk nice but try to make me seem like an idiot that doesn’t know what he is talking about. And when the service does go down they always say well our tech won’t be out to your location until Friday, and it’s the middle of the week. I have never had an isp take that long for repairs usually they are out the same day if not within hours. This place sucks. Plain and simple. If you can’t get some one out for service until the end of the week you may need more employees or just sell your business because you aren’t doing a very good job with the whole customer satisfaction part of your job.

resp.text: Mr. Duffy, thank you for your feedback. I see that your apartment complex is experiencing a property wide power outage. We have made an attempt to reach you, but the number on file has been disconnected. Please contact our office at 855.442.4908 and someone will be happy to give you an update. Unfortunately, our services will not work without power to our equipment.

name: Rodney Barstein
text:
I cannot say enough about Kevin, Rachel. Marcus and  the entire Xcelerate Network team. No one wants to have this company's phone number on speed dial as that means only one thing- constant calls to complain about service level. I can tell you they are not on my speed dial.
While every company has occasional issues- that is technology today- no one stands behind their service better that Xcelerate. After hours or holidays do not mean anything to them. Traveling is not a problem. They are available 24/7 to resolve any issues. One time Kevin even took a tv off of his wall to help us until he could order a replacement tv for a power surge issue. Bottom line is I have used them for 4 properties and will continue as due to their outstanding service.

name: Allison McBride
text: A+++ to Marcus Hart and team for the EXCELLENT SERVICE when they came to our Lake House to set up Direct TV. Great job, guys! THANK YOU!!!

name: Keith Walker
text:
For the past ~2 days, I've been experiencing some slow downs in my internet speeds, especially at night. Last night, Wednesday, 5/01/2018, my internet was virtually nonexistent. I woke up this morning and called Xcelerate Networks right at 8am. This is one of the reasons why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. I was on hold for approximately 20-30 minutes before someone finally answered. I explained to the lady, I didn't catch her name, my issues and she stated that it would be escalated to a next-level technician and told me that is all that she could do. At first, I was a little weary because of the negative reviews that I've read here. Thirty minutes later, to my amazement, I received a phone call from Candace. She asked a few more questions and then let me know there would be a technician out today to check out my issues. At this point, I was thoroughly surprised. The technician showed up maybe 30 minutes after that and resolved the issue within an hour.

So....for the 2nd reason I'm giving only 4 stars, having one technician available for this apartment complex on Thursdays only? That's a little ridiculous. 10 years ago, that might have been okay but many people, myself included, rely on the internet to make a living. If my internet goes down on a Friday then I don't make any money for an entire week and have a potential for customer loss. The last reason for 4 stars....the speeds, 30Mbps max down, really!? Two months ago, I relocated to Alabama from Alaska, the last frontier, limited access to anything, the middle-of-nowhere. Even in Alaska, I had access to 1Gbps down for just a little more than what I'm paying now.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Walker for your feedback.

name: Tiffany Harris
text: I'd give it no stars if I could! This is the third time in 3 weeks that my internet has been out. The first time they had not moved me in their system from my old address (which i transferred from over a year ago) so instead of contacting me they just cut the internet off. We resolved that and the second week they said it was the same issue again and took 3 days to come out and fix it! Now today I am again without internet since last night and have called the number 6 times. It rings and rings and no answer. Finally got someone (two hours later) and they claim a tech was headed to my complex (for another issue) so he'd look into my issue. Smh! It is just so unfortunate that complex's contract themselves with companies and force them on their residents! Total bs!

name: David Harris
text: This internet is terrible always off never works to slow to stream sucks to be stuck with a local internet company due to contracts with your apartment complex but when you call you would swear they were in San Antonio or something and also you don’t get reimbursed for the days you didn't have service ...by the way the internet is off now smh lol

name: Johnathan Quinn
text: Xcellent service and helpful friendly staff. Every cable and internet companies have problems from time to time with equipment, BUT the difference with Xcelerate is that they are in the area and quick to respond to issues.

name: Will Harris
text: I have been with Southside Apartment company for over 2 years now. At first I did have some problems with Xcelerate, but now I very rarely have problems with connection and if I do I can call one of the technicians to come fix it within the day.. If you have problems, go to the Xcelerate office next to the Southside office and meet with someone to send someone to you,  instead of calling the 855 phone number. Overall, the service has been great!

name: David Saleeby
text: I live in an apartment complex and was forced to have Xcelerate as my internet service provider. The speed has always been well below what is advertised. Myself and others have called dozens of times over the year I have lived here. They *always* say that they've gotten calls already and are sending out a technician within the week. Any fix they do only "works" for a couple of weeks at most. Out of the year I have lived here, at least 5 weeks have had non-existent or connections so slow that a webpage won't load. I can't recommend against this ISP enough. Given the choice of Xcelerate or dial-up, I would choose dial-up. The slow sleeps of Xcelerate are a major reason that I am not renewing my lease at this apartment.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Saleeby. We are happy to assist and want all of our customers to be satisfied with their service. Can you tell us where what apartment complex you are referring to?

name: Jamshed Arslan
text:
My internet issue got resolved the same day it occurred. Mr. Marcus (Tech guy of Xcerelate) gave me his personal number in case of any future problems.
Now, internet is working as it is promised.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Arslan. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us. Our customer service team will be happy to assist.

name: Seizure
text:
5/16/19 -  11% packet loss.  Calls to them going to voicemail immediately.   👍

UPDATE 3/19/18 - THEYRE JUST ASKING FOR A LITTLE PATIENCE UNTIL THEY FIGURE IT OUT.  ITS ONLY BEEN 1 YEAR SO LETS ALL KEEP PATIENT AT THE PARK AT DEERFIELD AND KEEP PAYING.  1 YEAR GUYS JUST READ THAT.

Update 4/17/18 - Same thing as a week ago.

Update 4/10/18 -  I am still forced to have them as my provider.  The last 5 days I have had a 25-50% packet loss.  Tech support came and kept showing me speed tests even though I reported a packet loss issue.   He said I needed an upgrade.  He didn't ping to check my packet loss or do any cable tests.  After switching me to a "High Speed Port" I had the same packet loss.  AGAIN he showed me speeds.  I called the next day with the same exact complaint.   They sent another tech guy out to look at the issue.  They called 2 hours later to let me know it is fixed.  It is not fixed.  There is an Ethernet running from my apartments box to another box at the next apartment down.  This cable has been here since I originally posted the review(1 year+).  Below is a picture of my packet loss.  When I complained for the third time they say the tech is now too far away and will be scheduled to come tomorrow.  So that will be 6 days in with the same issue and not a single bit of improvement.  How many people actually listen and buy an upgrade when they say this? I have filed an informal complaint with the FCC.  I hope you don't make the same mistake as I did and think that you get to choose your ISP when you move into an apartment.  ALWAYS check.

Speeds are not what are advertised.  Can't even watch Netflix without constant buffering.  Consistently drops out for half a day.  Closed on the weekends when everyone is probably using it the most.  Currently been out over 12 hours.   Would never choose them if it wasn't forced by apartment complexes, but hey... gotta get business somehow right?

Update: less than a week later I get home to no internet again.  Sweet.

name: Lauren Crandall
text:
This is the WORST internet provider ever. The only thing that makes up for the terribly slow internet is the technicians who form set it up. They are all very nice and will do what needs to be done to fix the issue.

But actually getting them to your place is another story. You have to call a 1-800 number and sit on hold for at least 10 mins to give someone all your info then get transferred to the person who can help, that transfer usually means about 10-15 min hold. I LOVE my apartment but their service is the #1 reason I would consider moving. It is terrible, slow, and it always takes a long time to get someone out to fix it.

We have gone almost a week without internet several times here. Not just me, the entire complex. But you can't actually speak with a person from the company. They hired a third party to handle phone calls and there is no direct number to the office to speak about a discount since we had no service.

Never rent from a complex that uses this company, it's just not worth it.

name: David Koski
text: (I'm currently posting this review from my phone as the internet is currently down) Rhodes villas with Southside apt company provide this service built into your rent. Terrible internet and understaffed support. The internet will go out for days and then 2 hours to wait on hold with no help.  I would suggest you find another apartment complex with better service. It is the main reason I did not renew my lease.

name: Jaleesa L. Ivy
text:
This company is BY FAR the worst cable/internet provider I have ever dealt with. 0 stars is the real rating! I am being forced to utilize this company, due to my apartment complex having a contract with them. I would NEVER choose to utilize this company, on my own. My ISSUES- 1) I had to call to set up service and installation time. 2) I was on the phone, with a representative, for over a hour. That is not a good use of anyone's time or effort. 3) I asked for my install to be after 5pm, so I would not have to leave work. The customer service rep advised he would mark it in my notes. 4) Installs, in my area, are only completed on Tuesdays.1 doggone day out of 7. 5)The following Tuesday I received a call at 8am, asking was I at home because Xcelerate was at my house to complete my install. 6) Refer to item 3 where I asked for the install to be completed after 5pm.  7) I was asked by the technician to call my complex manager to see if someone could sit in my apartment. He advised he had work orders, in another city, that afternoon and could not complete the install that evening.  The apartment office was close, that day, and the install never happened.  Money, for an install and equipment, was also taken out of my account and the job has not been started or completed.!!  8) A rep from Xcelerate, called me, to discuss rescheduling. She advised that their install time is usually 8am-5pm and they hardly ever install outside of that time (Poor Customer Service). 9) I asked the rep could installs be completed, in my town, in the afternoon? She advised they could. The rep asked when I would be available and I explained to her I would be available the following Tuesday (which happens to be today) at 1. She advised the technician would call me at 12:00 or 12:30 to ensure I would be at home at 1. 10)This morning I called Xcelerate to ensure my install time was still 1pm, and I was told that it was. I left work for lunch, to have my wifi/cable installed. Guess what didn't occur,?!?! The install!  It's 3:14 and the install did not happen and I have not been contacted by the company.  I had to call Xcelerate to ask what happened?!?  I was told they could not make contact with the dispatcher (install technician) and they would have to call me back. Since they do not complete installs, after 5pm, I will be asking for a FULL refund. I will not go into a 3rd week without a service/equipment that was paid for on the first day.

SAVE yourself the TROUBLE! Look somewhere else!

******3/28/17 Update***** Xcelerate provided me with a full refund, and came to my apartment, on a Monday and after 5pm, to complete this install. The technician, Marcus, was very professional and completed my entire install within 15 mins. I am hoping that my opinion of this company fully changes, and the service I receive continues to get better.

name: Sunny Khurana
text: They help us for connection. But I will be keep updated about service

name: Ty Beahm
text: When your internet/cable goes out all the time, you are sold a router that is terribly inconsistent, your upgraded speeds aren't what were promised, you get disrespected by customer service for being upset with internet speeds, thus making you uncomfortable to even call with an issue, you have no option to get a new service provider because of a contract your complex has..

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We see where a representative reached out to you to notify you that weather caused the outage to your property. Lightening did hit a main switch on the property and was replaced this weekend. Please let us know if your services have not been restored.

name: Nick King
text: Inconsistent connection from the beginning. I'm beyond irritated.

resp.text: Mr. King we appreciate your feedback. I see that you were installed on Monday. We have made an attempt to reach you by phone and look forward to helping you resolve your concerns. Please contact a member of our office staff to assist you.

name: Taylor Stanley
text: Do NOT use this ISP. They are awful! If you want your internet to be routinely out or significantly less than what you are subscribed for then this is your company! I've had them for a few years because they are contracted with my apartment management...Xcelerate has yet to actually fix the issues that I face All Of The Time!!!

resp.text:
Hi Taylor,

We apologize for your inconvenience.  Please contact our office at 855.442.4908, and our staff would be happy to assist you.

name: anjum ali
text: worse internet provider ever, Customer service phones stay busy,or hold for hours,. This is the main reason i am moving from my apartment complex,as this the only company providing internet.

name: Gloria Koplon
text: As a direct tv user, I cannot he happier with any service provider other than Xcelerate. Sure there are random issues like power outages but Xcelerate is always there when I need them.

name: Henry Weatherly
text: I wish I could post a 0 star review. This company is a flaming pile of garbage. My landlord forced me to use them. The wifi cuts out randomly about once an hour.

name: Wendi Lackey Woolwine
text: Worse experience I have ever had and I have had service with many Alabama providers. The WORST!!!

name: Jonathan Alexander
text: Pathetic excuse for an Internet provider. They sign contracts with apartment complexes so you are stuck paying for this garbage in your rent and then you experience constant service interruptions for days at a time with no customer service to speak of. Horrible company. Avoid at all costs.

name: Dana Loconto
text: When something goes down, the cable or the internet, they work hard to fix the problem.

name: Jon Davis
text: Lazy employees, manager seems to be busy a lot or not available. Employees think they are doing you a favor instead of their paid job. Plus, employees seem not to be knowledgeable of working of phones, they just want to sell products to new customers. Not a functional location.

resp.text: Hello Jon Davis We want all of our customers to be given exceptional service every visit. We want to help everyone in a timely manner and apologize that this was not the case. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Please contact the area manager at bailey.godsey@livemobile.com and so we can find a resolution for you. If you do not receive a response in a timely manner email ethan.watters@livemobile.com.

name: Jody Johnson
text: NOT AN AUTHORIZED DEALER. They will make deals they cant honor. Go to alabaster. Im one of four first responders lied to or at least withheld info to make the deal for firstnet happen. They don’t even deny making the deal mostly just shrug their shoulders like oh well can’t win them all.

resp.text: Hello Jody Johnson Our number one goal is to provide you with an exceptional customer experience. This is not the experience we wanted you to have. We apologize and want to correct this! Please contact the area manager at bryan.hale@liveatt.com so we can find a resolution for you.

name: Stephen Moss
text:
I was surprised how easy the team at this location made my switching carriers. Actually listened to me, got me what I wanted without trying to up sell and did it happily.

I found they still carried the iPhone 11 and got that to upgrade my sweetie's old 7 again at a great price with no hassles!

What sealed the deal was them going above and beyond helping complete the number porting process after T-mobile dropped the ball and was of no help.

resp.text: Hello Stephen Moss Our number one goal is to provide you with an exceptional customer experience. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers! Hope to see you again!

name: Darlene Hancock
text: Blake is your guy to help you. His other employees are just as friendly and helpful as he is. Alabaster and Hoover made me so upset I wanted to cancel service. Blake redeemed the name of AT&T and I'm thankful he took the time to help.

resp.text: Hello Darlene Hancock Serving our customers with the best service possible is something we strive for every day. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers! We hope to connect with you soon.

name: james ingram
text: Was very nice and took the time to get everything we needed

resp.text: Hello james ingram Serving our customers with the best service possible is something we strive for every day. Our number one goal is to provide you with an exceptional customer experience. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers! We hope to connect with you soon.

name: Gionna Godsey
text: Blake is always so helpful and informative. I would definitely recommend Calera AT&T!

resp.text: Hello Gionna Godsey Thank you for reaching out. We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers!

name: david perot
text: Blake is a true professional and met every need that was important to me and my wife!

resp.text: Hello david perot Our number one goal is to provide you with an exceptional customer experience. Serving our customers with the best service possible is something we strive for every day. We hope to connect with you soon.

name: Tom Sigg
text: The guy I worked with did a great job. Simply for him I would give 5 stars. However the woman in the store with blue hair was not pleasant.

resp.text: Hello Tom Sigg We want all of our customers to be given exceptional service every visit. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers! We're sorry we fell short of your expectations.

name: Caroline Bullard
text: The store was understaffed;nevertheless, the person there was calm and professional.  I got exactly the items I needed.  If you are trying to decide between going to the ATT store in Alabaster of the one in Calera, do yourself and your blood pressure isa favor and go to Calera.

resp.text: Hello Caroline Bullard We want all of our customers to be given exceptional service every visit. We're sorry we fell short of your expectations.

name: Tommy Gray
text: I has been dealing with this store for years. This last time I went in there was horrible I will never go back to this store. They sold me my phone and watches and sent me on my way. I had to go to the alabaster store to get my stuff fixed. Also the lady that’s in the store is very rude.

name: Ray A Huckabone
text:
My Spectrum experience has not been great since we moved here a year ago. We had difficulties and getting anyone to do anything about it was near impossible. Customer service was rude as was one of the Techs sent to the house. Issue finally resolved after many days, phone calls and techs in the home.
Fast forward to Sep 2020. Spectrum updating system and needed to pick up new box and self install by the 22nd. Went to the store only to find out boxes would not be in ghe store until the 22nd.
Called customer service, no problem, we’ll send one out. Box arrived, no instructions nor remote. Hooked it up with assistance of customer service, had picture for 5 minutes then went black screen. She made a same day apt for me.
Tech arrived, gave us a remote, worked awhile and got one channel working. Said it could take a day for everything to come up. Ten minutes after he left it went black screen. Several calls later got another apt. 8:30 at night I called because it was 2 hours passed the apt time. Told it was still opend. Told him to show in the morning. They called me at 9:23 pm when I was sleeping and since I didn’t answer the phone they cancelled work order.
Made another apt and it was cancelled for some reason.
Got connected with a supervisor in SC who got me a 5 pm apt. Tech showed up 10 to 5, said it probably needed rebooted, thst had been done numerous times. I told him he was supposed to bring a new box.
Didn’t have any, off to the store 10 minutes away to get one. After an hour I called and cancelled my service.
I’ve been thru way too much in my life to be treated like this.
Bottom line-
-Customer Service is there to make you feel good. They can’t do squat
-Supervises are there to tell you stuff to appease you and get you off there back, basicly lie to you.
-The techs that came in my home had no purpose being here.
As for me and my family, we choose books.

name: Brock Murphy
text: Always horrible service at the stores.  They are not very knowledgeable about issues that you are having with your phone.  I have two contacts in my phone that call and get sent straight to VM.  It doesn’t show a missed call either.  I ran through 1.5 hours with apple on a chat.  Checked online after they couldn’t fix it and found that the only thing that i had not tried is a new SIM card. I figured what could it hurt i have tried everything else.  He changed my SIM card and gave my phone back to me after checking the usual and asking the same questions that i had already told him that apple support sent me through. He even suggested that if the callers that went straight to VM had my number blocked.  I can call them but they cannot call me.  This doesn’t make any sense.  After a couple of minutes with the new SIM card my service had not activated yet.  I mentioned it to him. He checked the phone line and said that it is a good on his end that it could take up to six hours and if it still did not have service to call att and they would take care of the issue over the phone.  Just one question i have is why are they even there if they have no idea how these things work and if they have to have me call att just to activate my card.  Worthless in my opinion.

resp.text: Hello Brock, This is not the experience we wanted you to have. Please contact the store at 256-331-1927 and ask to speak to a manager so we can get a resolution for you. We want to make this right.

name: Crystal Pitts
text: I went to this store to establish internet service. I paid my $100 deposit in cash and was told my installation date. The day came for installation and no one showed. I reached out to the employee Scott who created my order and he said because of the rain there were delays. I ended up getting an approx. date for installation from Bishop which was on a Sunday(which At&t is closed...so how was that). Of course, no one showed. So I called At&t directly and inquired about it and was told they saw the account created but they saw nothing about my payment or info of an installation date for me. I made another $100 deposit with my debit card directly with At&t & I was advised to go back to the store to obtain a full refund of the cash payment. I've gotten the biggest run around at this store. They tell me I'm going to get my money back and they'd call me but NO ONE EVER CALLS ME WITH ANYTHING! I've constantly had to go out to this store just to see what the status was and they always tell me they are working on it and would call! NEVER HAPPENED! I finally spoke to the manager Sam and he supposedly filled out the necessary paperwork on the computer so I could get my refund sent via check in the mail within six weeks. ITS BEEN 5 MONTHS!! NO CHECK!! Went out there yet again and Scott informs me that Sam's no longer with them and they now have a temp manager and he wasn't going to address him with the issue because he wasn't going to be there long. Scott said the district manager was coming to the store a little later that evening to drop off a customer's phone. He assured he get my concern to the district manager once he arrived at the store and he would call me also once he arrived so I could speak to him. NEVER HAPPENED! I popped up on a different day and spoke to the temp manager and he agreed that it shouldn't have been this complicated and he'd look into it. Come to find out the employee Scott made an error by taking cash instead of a credit/debit card. He rung it up as if I was making a cell deposit which allowed the acceptance of cash because if he rung it up as internet it wouldn't have allowed him to accept cash instead it would've prompted for credit/debit card. The temp manager said he emailed two different people on the cell phone side to see how he can go about obtaining my refund and he said he'd call me. Things felt promising because it seemed he was being genuine! He said he'd called once he heard something(which would take a few days). I've given it almost two weeks and no call no nothing! I called a day ago to speak with the temp manager and Bishop told me he was with a customer. Bishop asked for my name, contact number, and reason for wanting to speak to him. Bishop said he'd have him call and I thought he would since he was in the store. I WAS WRONG! IM STILL YET TO GET ANYWHERE WITH THIS MATTER AND MY PATIENCE IS VERY THIN AT THIS POINT! IM SICK AND TIRED OF THE RUN AROUND! I JUST WANT MY MONEY BACK SO I CAN PUT THIS MATTER BEHIND ME! I'VE BEEN MORE THAN PATIENT AND UNDERSTANDING!!! I know they have other things on their to do list but I feel that my situation should be some form of a priority given that the mistake was on the employee. It shouldn't take over 5 months for this situation to be resolved but when the workers aren't trying to do nothing about it....nothing will get done! Every time I've went out there everyone is just standing around doing the usual. I feel nobody is taking it seriously nor are they putting in a conscious effort to ensure I get my refund!! They never have to be concerned about me coming back to this store after I obtain my money!!!

name: Ann Rodgers
text: Jessie is FABULOUS! LOVE working with her.

name: Laquanta Hale
text:
Scott, I believe that is his name was very helpful when I initially purchased my phone. Although, the store phone rang several times while I was there and the other employees in the store did not answer it.

After finding out that the phone would not work for the purpose I had brought it, I looked to return it. Well this was after several attempts in trying to make it work. I called the store on the 14th day, because I had recently had a procedure and can't drive myself. I was trying to get someone at the store to see how I needed to proceed or if I could proceed, but the phone was never answered on the three times I called  I was given the opportunity to go by the store today on the 15th day and was denied returning my phone.

I understand that there are policies and procedures that have to be followed, but I feel this could have been handled differently. As a manager, I know that some times you have to go against policies to take care of your customers.... Just very disappointed in my service today.

text: I came in yesterday unsure of which new iPhone I wanted. Brandon kindly explained the differences between the iPhone 12 and the 12 pro in depth, and he answered any and all the questions I had. She explained to me how to trade in my current phone to basically get the iPhone 12 for free! She even convinced me to buy a pair of AirPods which I’m TOTALLY OBSESSED with now. Overall, the customer service at the Winfield AT&T was phenomenal!!! I will definitely be coming back soon!

name: Jennifer Black
text: To be honest, it was terrible.   I upgraded to a phone with a bad battery and I had the phone less than 3 days.  First. I was told I was going to have to pay the restocking fee and mind you this is a defective phone, a phone AT&T was going to have to take back and take a look at.  Then,  I was told I had to pay the defective phone off in full before I could do anything.  I had not had the phone 14 days AND it was defective.  I took my products and went to Hamilton.  No paying a restocking fee or paying off a defective phone.  They were happy to swap out a phone and worked with the products I had taken from Winfield.  Just do yourself a favor and don't shop there.

name: Sam Jimenez
text: So thankful that our trouble was resolved by tech, Mr. Wade Clark. This was absolutely the BEST customer service I have ever experienced with Frontier! Mr. Clark was very kind, polite, knowledgeable, and professional while making the necessary repairs to our service. This man is a perfect example of how every customer's experience should be with Frontier,  whether it is on-site or front-line/over the phone! So many of us rely on our services to go uninterrupted in this time, frustrations rise when troubles occur, not only for the customer but for front-line technicians as well, and then you have Technicians like Mr. Clark who defuse the frustrations, resolve the problems, and nevertheless remain absolutely empathetic and patient. This man is an asset to Frontier Communications. Again, HUGE thanks to Mr. Clark for the hard work he puts into his job, and continuously risking his health during this virus to keep services uninterrupted.

name: Leeanne Gunther
text:
This may be a lengthy review.. but this is worth the read if you are considering Frontier for internet service.

On September 14th, I had an appointment to have high speed internet installed. However, I received a phone call a couple days before hand (they left a voicemail) that I would not be receiving internet services.

I called at 11:44am and was placed on hold for quite some time and could not stay on the phone for any longer as my lunch break was over.
I called again at 4:14pm. This call lasted 11 minutes. I was told that I could not get high speed but that I could get 12mb.

September 15th
I called Frontier again and I was told I could only get 6mb, then the statement was retracted, and I was told that I could not get any internet service at my location. I questioned this as I had been previously told that I could get 6mb, then I was told once again that I actually could get 6mb. So then I scheduled an appointment for 10/6/2020 to have the internet installed.

October 6th
Frontier was scheduled to come between 1pm-5pm. I had to work, so I had a friend come over to my house on their day off so someone could be there. Frontier came at 9:30am and left a note on the door that they needed to bury a drop box. I called frontier at 11:31am wondering why someone had arrived so early. I was on the phone until 11:47am during my lunch at work trying to get this figured out, but did not receive any answers. I was not very happy, as I assumed I would be receiving internet services this day. I would think that Frontier would know if I had a drop box at my house already? Frontier left me a voicemail that someone would be coming to run the lines for my internet on October 20th, and I would get internet installed on October 26th.

October 26th
I received a text reminder on October 25th to remind me of my upcoming appointment with Frontier. I also received another text message reminder on October 26th that Frontier would be coming to my house between 1pm-5pm. Once again, I had someone at my house as I usually work during these hours. Frontier never came... I called Frontier at 4:57pm wondering what was going on. Once again, I didn't really receive an answer. I was told that the department that I needed to talk to was already gone for the day and that they would give me a call the next day.

October 27th
I called Frontier again.. and explained that I have never had so many problems with a company before. I explained that I have been trying to get internet from them for almost 2 months now.. and I have had nothing but problems. They told me that a subcontractor needs to come out and run the lines before they can install internet... they also explained that they should be contacting me soon.. which I obviously didn't believe at this point. I told them I was very dissatisfied and that I would be going with a different internet company at this point.

October 30th
I went with a different company and have internet and am currently using it with no problems :)

text: What a terrible business! The level of unprofessionalism is overwhelming! I ordered their services a month ago and they finally came to install, only to leave because they forgot a tool. They never came back or called back. They was supposed to show up again 3 days ago but never called to explain why they did not show up. I spent 3 hours talking to customer service only to be disregarded and hung up on. One customer service provider even answered only to blow into the phone for a few minutes before hanging up. I was hung up on on four different occasions. I spoke to one of the highest ranking Supervisors, Zachary, Employee Id #948556 and he told me there was nothing he could do and that he was "sorry", then after all the inconvenience he suggested that it was  "policy" that I still pay the 80$ installation fee. I now see why they have failing business nationwide. Please do not waste your time. I have never seen a company conduct themselves in such a childish manner.

Turns out the only office around here doesn't let you walk in to handle any business. So what am I supposed to do now? Oh I got it. I'll go with a different service.

name: 1John 2:15
text: I have had frontier, by default, internet service for about 4 years now. since I signed up with them, it's been nothing but problems. I have had so many service calls for lack of speed(supposed to be "up to" 6mbps but had maybe 1) and frequent internet drops or disconnects. First, I want to say, the technicians hands are tied as far what they can do. they are doing the best they can to put band aids on these old lines and keep them running. But still to this day, I have quite a few internet disconnects a day. I have just given up on them ever fixing the problem and should mention that this happens every year sometimes more than once were my internet will just stop working and they fix it And then it works fine for a few weeks then it goes back to frequent disconnects and so on. the technicians have measured as many as 400 disconnects in a 24 hr period. If they would just upgrade these lines and may run some fiber optic to some of the main hubs then these problems would stop. I wish I could say I'm the only one with these problem.s but my neighbors all say the same thing. I was told these lines were originally only run to be used for phone. But my parents live next door and they always  have issues with both internet and phone. they have lots of really loud staic in the lines and sometime buzzing so loud you can't hear anything and often times the phone just doesn't work. so even if these lines in our area were supposed to be used primarily for landline phones, obviously they aren't sufficient for that either. so why not replace them with new lines and have satisfied customers instead of reviews and complaints like this? because they don't care about those of us who are getting terrible service. they have no competition here to worry about so they know they can ignore us and continue to collect our money. the moment another company moves in, a lot of us in this area will be switching. I cannot stand this local frontier company. they used to have a local office close by but shut it down. I would assume because of the crowds of angry customers. if I could give them negative 5 stars, I would.

name: me to you
text:
Great experience. You are greated with a warm welcoming, "Welcome to Verizon" by Janet. This is a "corporate" store as opposed to a privately owned store further south on Hwy 59.
I guess that accounts for the "friendly and welcoming" service.

The personnel in the other store are rude, unwelcoming, and I witnessed the woman manager arguing with a woman customer.

This corporate store was friendly and helpful to everyone.  I thought Janet was the manager at the Corporate store because she has such a welcoming and caring work attitude. The woman manager never looked up, never said a word to me or anyone else that I noticed on my first visit to the store. Her focus was on a cell phone the entire time, but my second visit the next day, the manager was more active but not friendly nor did I see her greet anyone.

The young man, Justin, was helpful and very knowledgeable about cell phones.  He fixed what needed fixing right away.

I recommend Justin and Janet as your "go to person".  In Oct I plan to upgrade cell phone because this one is no longer made or sold. I guess 2011 to 2019 is good use for a cell phone. I could not get the charger to recharge it because of a frayed wire and a loose port. The 2 refurbished phones, so far, have been a pain. For 2 weeks I have had apps that do not open, then suddenly they open on their on accord.

name: Randall Strain
text: For years my wife used the Verizon owned store down the street from this store. She got tired of the wait lines and decided to use this store.  Since using this store her bill has fluctuated from month to month and no one there could or would tell us why. I was finally able to find out why. This store is a franchised store and your payment is not processed until the next day, and you will be stuck with a late fee.  If your bill is due by the 29th, you had better pay it on the 28th, because the store owner will not be honest about it. I remembered paying my bill at the company owned store down the street many times on the last day and never was I hit with a late charge. The Verizon owned store will get our business from now on.  They told me when I went there to get this info, honesty is the best policy, and their payments go in that very day. What a concept!!!

name: Courtney McNaughton
text:
I’ve been with AT&T from the beginning. When it was still Cingular, ha! So, about 21 years now. Anyway...

On Tuesday, 11/02/2020 (Election Day) my iphone went out due to water damage. So, I had to get a new one. I had absolutely NO intention of purchasing ANYthing in store, because of the not so good experiences I’ve had at nearby AT&T stores (Schillinger Rd S) l. I’d rather buy online. Even said that to a friend before I called, ha!
However, I had some questions. So, I googled AT&T. I clicked on the first location that popped up, which happened to be the one in Semmes on Moffett and Schillinger. A young man by the name of Jarius answered the phone. Immediately, I could tell how friendly he was and quite humorous😆 One of those people who you know right off, is just a kind and genuine guy, ya know? He went out of his way to answer the questions I had. Even answered questions I didn’t even ask, but wanted to. Questions that I was afraid to ask. Mainly, because of the last location (Schillinger Rd S) I went to (about a year ago) to get my watch, seemed annoyed and rushed from the very beginning. Which made me feel like a burden rather than a paying customer. It’s actually happened every time I’ve been to that location. Never thought to go to another, because I just assumed that they all act that way. Due to such poor service in the past, it’s now come to the point where I dread having to get any new device from them. Although, that all changed after speaking to Jarius for that brief moment on the phone. After getting the information I needed, I made it a point to go to the Moffett Rd location to purchase my new phone from HIM, specifically. Which ended up being a great decision! I knew exactly who he was when I walked in, based on seeing his pleasant demeanor and friendly facial expressions towards other customers.

He greeted me, and I told him  what I wanted. He didn’t even ask me what color I wanted. Instead, he took it upon himself to bring ALL five colors out, so I could see them up close in order to make my decision. I chose my phone. He took it out of the box...next thing you know———HE has my WHOLE phone set up for me! Even did the facial recognition. This has NEVER happened. From walking in, to leaving, it took about 20 minutes, maybe? Typically, it takes at least an hour to get the phone —which they just give to me to take home and do it myself. Which for me? Takes another hour or two, ha!  By the way, [in the past] I’ve asked them to help me, and they’ve refused. Claiming it’s against policy. Which, I know now, is a lazy lie. It’s been a few days since I’ve gotten my new phone, and yet, I’m still thinking about and telling others of the excellent service I received—sending people their way. Also, I HAVE to mention Tre (the manager) who came over while Jarius was doing his thing. He came over to make sure everything was going smoothly and checked to see if I was getting the best deals they had to offer—which HE made sure I did🙏He was friendly, personable, and just all around pleasant. He didn’t have to come over, because Jarius had it all under control. However,  he did, and I saw him doing that with all of the other customers as well. Those two really want people to be satisfied and it’s completely evident.

I, myself, have worked in customer service for about 15 years. So, I appreciate and know good (great!) service when I see it.  As long as Jarius and Tre are working for AT&T—I will continue to go there. Because I literally put off getting a new phone for 2 years (had it for 4) because it always seemed like a chore any time I was thinking of getting a new one. I know this review is a bit lengthy...but the experience was like no other, that just couldn’t be explained in a short summary. That, and they deserve it! Again, thank you Jarius and Tre!!🤗

text: I wish there was less than 1 star. I absolutely hate this company. Unfortunately there is no provider in my area. I can only only pray there is a special place in Hell for companies like this.

text: I have never felt so ripped off by a company. Century link is the only internet provider in our area, and I have to have internet for my at home business or I would drop them in a heartbeat. most of the time our internet is so slow it will not even allow me to stream a movie without stopping at some point in the middle. not to mention we are paying nearly triple the cost of the internet service we had at our last house.

name: Blair White
text: Century Link is by far the worst internet service provider in Alabama and maybe in the southeast. If you live in Foley, AL, you have no choice but to go with Century Link for Internet service. You pay top dollar for extremely slow internet that doesn't work half the time especially after 6 pm on week days. It is mind blowing to me that in the year 2015, cable internet is not offered in Foley, AL. People think that I live in the middle of no where when I tell them that cable internet is not an option. But I just say no, I actually live right in the middle of a city. It's just a city that allows only one internet provider which is called a monopoly which is illegal!! Century Link and this monopoly is so ridiculous, my family and I would seriously consider moving just to get away from it! Which is completely unacceptable that we would have to do that!! Ugh I hate Century Link!!!!

name: Michael Hunt
text:
I have bonded DSL.  2 months no problem, satisfied with the service, but I don't have a contract so I am paying a ridiculous $85.00 a month for 15 down/2 up which has averaged in that area.  I am on a work site and don't need another contract to break so this was the way to go.  I have no phone.  Yesterday I had to create a skype number because of cell phone problems.  Guess what?  My internet is throttled today.  If I go to the "Century Link" speed test it shows I am pulling 15.1 down/1.51 up.  Of course I am not every other speed test shows with the closest local in Daphne AL at 2.46 down/ up 1.47.  In fact most of the other non centurylink speed test show a higher upload on about 1 then download.  I've reset the equipment and the desktop is directed wired.  The equipment is up and on par.
This is clearly throttling and should be illegal.  I've had no warning that I hit some limit.  Trying to located a real human to take to is impossible slow and hard to locate.  Do not use the worthless chat its a no go and a pawn in modern customer service.  I can't wait to get out of here and back home with Fiber optic.  The rural people better pay attention to the fish they elect that spawn with the corporate cows.  The internet is not a luxury for a mobile advanced society.  Get it regulated and make these suckers deliver what they are selling at high prices.

name: Blair White
text: Century Link is by far the worst internet service provider in Alabama and maybe in the southeast. If you live in Foley, AL, you have no choice but to go with Century Link for Internet service. You pay top dollar for extremely slow internet that doesn't work half the time especially after 6 pm on week days. It is mind blowing to me that in the year 2015, cable internet is not offered in Foley, AL. People think that I live in the middle of no where when I tell them that cable internet is not an option. But I just say no, I actually live right in the middle of a city. It's just a city that allows only one internet provider which is called a monopoly which is illegal!! Century Link and this monopoly is so ridiculous, my family and I would seriously consider moving just to get away from it! Which is completely unacceptable that we would have to do that!! Ugh I hate Century Link!!!!

name: Heather Haynes
text:
We just bought a home in the limits of Owens Cross Roads and the ONLY internet provider that provides for the area is New Hope Telephone CoOp. When the internet is working it is very nice.  However, for the last week, every single night when we go to watch television(we have Roku package and Netflix) in our bedroom instead of the living room, the wifi WILL NOT WORK. We have tried restarting the router and it's useless. We pay 75 dollars for the smallest internet package. It would be nice if it would actually work in our room, but 60% of the time it does not.

They gave us two wifi domains (I'm not sure about terminology) but 90% of the time only one is avaible. Which is extremely annoying.

Overall, I would not use this company but it is the only company we have as an option.   Sigh.

name: Daniel Martin
text:
Great and reliable service. I have just reviewed every telephone company in Alabama and all the people that take the time to write a review say they wish they had some other provider...kind of funny.  New Hope Telephone averages one hour trouble repair responses which is absolutely unheard of today, get that from AT&T, Comcast, Charter or any other provider, try 2 to 7 days from those companies.  Oh by the way it won't be long and we will have GIG internet availability as well...not bad from a rural provider when Birmingham, Mobile, Montgomery and Huntsville doesn't even have it yet.

The reason that NHTC is most people’s only ISP provider is the cost of operation and homes-per-mile available to serve. Other companies are free to serve the same area but choose not to due to the low profitability. NHTC isn’t a monopoly by choice but they are the only company that strives to provide service to an area that would otherwise not have it. That’s why telecom cooperatives were created by the people they serve. Great service and great employees!

resp.text: Thank you, Daniel!

name: Maggie
text:
I live in the middle of nowhere, and I'll put up with anything.
I'll sign up for some garbage internet service-
you know, I don't want to name an actual internet provider,
so let's just make one up; let's call it "Pinebelt Wireless".

So I'll sign up for "Pinebelt Wireless", and I'll turn on the router, and I'll go, "Can I get on the internet now, please?"
And they go, "No. We're fixing the towers."
And I go, "Okay!"
And then I do something else for a while.
And then I come back and I go, "Will it work now?" and they go,
"Yeah. But you won't be able to load video because we HATE you. Now go visit your websites, and only half the page will load, and the connection will drop in TEN MINUTES. Now go on, GET!"

And I go, "Okay" and I try to get on the internet,
and I go, "Can I download a file, please?"
and they go, "NO!"
and I go "Okay!"
and they go, "You're a little peasant aren't you?"
and I go, "no"
and they go "SAY IT!!"
and I go "I'm a little peasant"

And then I call Pinebelt Customer Service, which is an oxymoron, and I go, "Can I please find out why my internet doesn't work? When the towers will be fixed?"
And they go, "NO! In fact, we've given everyone else a free upgrade, but not you because your satisfaction is meaningless. You can't afford any other provider, so you'll have nothing, or you'll have the nothing that WE give you, and you will take the nothing that WE give you and YOU'LL LIKE IT."
and I go, "Why are you doing this to me?"
And they go, "Because we're Pinebelt Wireless, and life is a nightmare!"

name: Stan Goodley
text: AT&T  3 days ago (Saturday) I moved a few miles down the road to an apartment complex that is wired exclusively for one internet provider, @AT&T. Prior to moving I was told by a AT&T customer service that since the building is already wired for AT&T, all I needed to do was take my router with me and plug it in at my new apartment. I double checked, “are you sure?”, to which I was again assured that it was just that simple. Several days later I move and plug the router in. No internet. I call AT&T and tell them what happened, and they scheduled a technician to come to my apartment several days later (Tuesday) to activate my service. It’s Tuesday night now, so I call and ask when I can expect to see the tech. After a long process of being put on hold and transferred to a “manager”, I’m told that I didn’t actually have an appointment. Even worse, they told me that it would be THREE WEEKS until they’d be able to get someone out to my apartment. I live in downtown Birmingham, a relatively big city, and they don’t have a single tech that can spend 20 minutes activating my internet service. Are you kidding me AT&T? What if I worked from home, or if I had a kid who was learning remotely? What if I caught covid and couldn’t leave for 2 weeks but still had to work? I literally have no other options besides using AT&T and they know this. I was misled multiple times by their representatives, then told to wait for nearly a month for a service I ALREADY PAY FOR. I’ve never posted any sort of product or service complaint, but this is the worst experience I’ve had as a customer. I really hope people see this and think twice before they switch to AT&T. Don’t do it!

resp.text: Hello Matt H. We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates. If it is convenient for you, we have staff at our retail locations that might be able to assist you with your issue.

name: Aaron Mahan
text:
Had a surprisingly great experience, compared to a recent encounter with my current carier, when I went in to check out the Galaxy S10+ to see if it felt right . The store representative, Bailey, was extremely helpful and made what was just a quick look into a great discussion about what I need in this phone and a very pleasant experience. His knowledge on the Galaxy phones was extensive and I was able to come to a decision quickly during our talk. I work in tech and didn’t feel like I was trying to be sold to or have someone try and get me to buy something lease, but felt like I was talking to a peer about these new phones.

While I was there, he was also able to check and see if AT&T Fiber was available in my neighborhood yet (it wasn’t) and talked me through how to know when that would occur.

Overall, AT&T keeps impressing me with each encounter I have with their customer service reps and if every rep was as knowledgeable and pleasant as Bailey, they would no doubt be rated the top in customer service. Once I they have Fiber available, I’m switching back over.

name: J Fleming
text: The last few times myself or my family have been to an ATT store it has been far from a pleasurable experience. The atmosphere has become that of a used car lot . The sales Reps work off commission  ,and as soon as they see you are not switching to Direc tv, or whatever else they are selling, they shut down and don’t want to help you. Because of this I have been going to the Apple store to purchase my devices. A few days ago I went into this ATT store to get a new I phone because I needed it ASAP.  I went in to strictly buy an iPhone and nothing else . After declining all the other sales pitches, I pay the sales tax get my receipt and go on my way . The next day I got an email showing the changes to my plan . The sales rep decided she was going to enroll me in the next plan and add insurance to my phone . I didn’t ask for or authorize any of that . She did not mention she was doing it either . This kind of behavior is far past unethical. So the next days I have spent much of my valuable time  calling corporate straightening this out . I have been an Att customer for over 20 years . I no longer have any trust in them .   Buyer beware!!!!!!

resp.text: Hello J. Your experience in our store matters to us. We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates, and this is not the experience we wanted you to have. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Our goal is to provide a better experience in the future.

***************UPDATE**************
After I received my bill, AT&T charged me for an additional line that I did not add. Customer Service would not let me speak to a supervisor, he took my number and said a supervisor would call me. NO return call! I ask the store to call customer service while I was there and was basically told no they would not do that. I’m going back in the morning again after customer service said again the store needs to correct but if it’s not resolved I’ll be changing to another carrier (after more than 10 years at AT&T). name: Ashley Johnigan
text:
Excellent Experience. Safety insured during Pandemic

Update: I received my first bill after I bought my iPhone and also an iPad. I was charged for two iPads on my bill and nothing was done about it. The manager could not be found and no one knew exactly when he would be in the store. I had to pay a restock fee of $55.00 after being told that there was no way anyone else in the store could give credit back on the additional iPad that was charged to my account.

Initially  the customer service representative told me that my bill would only increase by $5.00. However, I was charged $60.00 for the iPad on the first bill and $24.97 for another iPad I didn’t even buy!! I had to call 611 in order to get a credit on my bill for the amount that I was lied to about. Also, the customer service representative that sold me the iPad was there and did not take the initiative to apologize for the lack of explanation of the bill. There was insurance placed on the iPad without my knowing. I didn’t notice until I looked at the bottom of the receipt and bill on today!  I will never visit this AT&T again. Also, not being able to get in touch with a manager when needed is awful. Especially if the manager is scheduled to be at work and is the only that can take care of certain issues!!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Ashley, thank you for stopping by the South Tuscaloosa retail store on today, like always we value your loyalty with the company as our customer and hope to see you again soon!

name: Julia D
text: I am not an ATT customer,  but my father is. My father has been diagnosed with dementia.  Anyway, he went in to get a new flip phone and was told that ATT does not make them anymore. They then sold him a Touch screen phone and he didn't know how to answer or make a call.  I then went online and ordered an ATT flip phone because they do still manufacture them. Dad tried to return the phone a couple days later but came back with the phone. Since I know that his mind works differently now I told him we would go back the following Monday, which we did.  My dad was a little upset feeling like he was lied to when we got there----that did not help for sure. The ATT employee was immediately defensive and disrespectful.  I felt sorry for the young man because I know he'll never get anywhere in life like that. I then decided to speak for my dad and push him out of the way to calm his attitude,  but the employee seemed spiteful and maintained his little smirk. Totally not helpful. There was a level headed employee who came over and explained the phone price vs restock fee.  We ended up keeping the phone due to restocking fee. My advice to ATT is dont forget that Americans still value customer service and a smile. Those two ingredients can bring light into any retail situation. I'll never spend money on bad customer service.

resp.text: Hi Julia D. Our number one goal is to provide you with an exceptional customer experience. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers and look forward to providing you a better experience in the future.

name: Cam Duff
text:
Comparable devices and prices to other providers in safe price bracket. But cellular reception is unreliable and there is little to no accountability or acknowledgement of this big problem from the staff. Stores often don't have devices that are being marketed, or they don't have the accessories to protect your new phone or enhance features you pay for. Stores are filthy and the high turnover rate in employees means that you may not be able to talk to the person who set up your account or get what you were promised by a former employee after they screw up. And there are only a few local stores, all owned by the same person, so unlike other similar carriers, you don't have anyone to go to if you are unsatisfied with the service you receive.
I strongly recommend you check out Metro by T-Mobile and Cricket for the price range.

text: Beware of this store and Jasmin. We came in seeking new phones because we were moving out of state and Metropcs doesn't work in our new home. We wanted new phoned and new numbers but were told we had to port our numbers and wait 24 hours to change them. We ported over four phones which she said all four numbers were approved. Then suddenly after 2 hours one of the phones wouldn't port. We were there for almost 6 hours and left with three phones instead of four. We were going to cancel the entire transaction but  promises of half off our first bill. Being a $50 credit which we never received and we now had to pay for the fourth pbone seperatly at another store when we moved. Making this transaction $200 more than it was supposed to be. When we called to inquire about our $50 off the first bill we were given fake answers for a week. Then told it was our fault for changing our phone number and called liars. Boost seems like a good company thus far from everyone we have delt with accept Jasmin who is incredible dishonest and lied to us ust to get a sale and cost us hundreded of extra dollars.

text: purchased a new phone and service couple months ago and the employees were friendly but lacked the knowledge of the right service plans needed to fit customer needs. I informed the worker that I needed the most data available in order for me to do online classes in college & made sure mentioned what devices Would be used on hotspot if decided to and if the area Where I would be temporarily had good service because I'd be doing alot of reading, researching, and writing. The phone I have no complaints about and loved it, but the service plan she recommended, didn't work for me at all! I could never get signal anywhere, And Ran out of data in two days and had to purchase more twice in 4 days. Nothing they could do, and couldn't upgrade until my original plan expired which was 15 days away! My total amount spent from purchasing plan and cell ended up being $500 within 8 days of service with Boost! Needless to say, I am  now with another carrier and everything goes as it expected except for the occasional interference every now and then.

name: Dylastion Tuten
text: I went into att in scottsboro for them to set me up on a prepaid account. They asked for my social security number to make sure that I didn’t owe att any money. As the man employee was getting me set up the manager came and took over the entire project. As I was sitting there the manager kept asking me if I owned a business and a bunch of other questions. I answered not knowing that they were signing me up for a business account. Through the entire time I was in there the manager never once told me what he was doing. While I was sitting there he started bragging about setting up drug dealers on business accounts as pharmaceutical companies. And how he has done it many times. So a couple weeks pass and I get a bill in the mail for $126 when the manager told me it would only be $65 plus tax. So I called the store to figure out what happened and the manager called me a liar. So I decided to go to the store the next off day I had. Well today I went to the store and the manager refused to deal with me because I refused to wear a mask for medical reasons. Then after me telling him about the medical issues he still made me wear a mask. And didn’t help in anyway to fix any of the problems I had and called me a liar. And he refused to tell me how to get in touch with anyone over him.  And for everyone wanting to do business with this store please wait until they have someone in management that is honest enough to tell you exactly what they are doing with your personal information. If I could give zero stars I would and hopefully they will get someone competent enough to do business the right and legal way!!! Hopefully someone will see this and get this problem taken care of!!!

resp.text: Hi Dylastion! Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We understand how frustrating this might be, and we apologize for any inconvenience. We'll get with the staff to ensure they are reviewing current promotions correctly with every customer. Thank you!
